summary: Email exchange between Jenna Dabbs (attorney at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP) and an unnamed SDNY prosecutor regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death and the ongoing investigation. The prosecutor confirms the investigation remains ongoing and discusses potential support for a victim/witness, while Dabbs inquires about civil forfeiture and possible prosecutions of other defendants.

persons.name: Jenna Dabbs
persons.role: Attorney at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP
persons.context: Author of initial email inquiring about the status of the SDNY investigation and potential civil forfeiture proceedings following Jeffrey Epstein's death; offers professional support to the prosecutors.

persons.name: Alex Conlon
persons.role: Attorney at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP
persons.context: Copied on the email exchange between Jenna Dabbs and the SDNY prosecutor.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP and are copied on the same email correspondence regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's death
events.description: The email exchange references the news of Jeffrey Epstein's death, which occurred earlier that day, and discusses its impact on the ongoing investigation.

events.title: SDNY investigation ongoing
events.description: The SDNY prosecutor states that the investigation into Epstein remains ongoing and that a brief statement was issued by their office that afternoon.

locations: 350 Fifth Avenue, Suite 7110, New York, New York (Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP office)
keyFacts: The email exchange occurs on August 10, 2019, the day of Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The SDNY prosecutor confirms the investigation into Epstein remains ongoing despite his death.
Jenna Dabbs inquires about potential civil forfeiture proceedings and criminal prosecutions against other defendants.
The SDNY prosecutor mentions attempting to provide immediate resources/support for a victim/witness (referred to as 'M') and suggests contact with FBI specialists.
The document indicates communication between private attorneys and federal prosecutors regarding the implications of Epstein's death for the case.
